feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS User Enumeration
entry.content:
Response discrepancy in the login and password reset forms in SilverStripe CMS before 3.5.5 and 3.6.x before 3.6.1 allows remote attackers to enumerate users via timing attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12849
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-005
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fwhr-g5r4-xgxf

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS User Enumeration
entry.content:

entry.title: [october/october] Stored Cross-Site Scripting October CMS
entry.content:
An svg file upload vulnerability in October CMS v3.4.4 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of a browser via a crafted svg file. Attackers must be authenticated as users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37692
  • https://okankurtulus.com.tr/2023/07/24/october-cms-v3-4-4-stored-cross-site-scripting-xss-authenticated/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r47v-rxcg-p28j

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo XSS
entry.content:
Croogo version 2.3.1-17-g6f82e6c contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Page name that can result in execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000510
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/847
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4h9-gv2m-9x97

entry.title: [austintoddj/canvas] Canvs Canvas XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Canvs Canvas version 3.4.2 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in User's details that can result in denial of service and execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000507
  • https://github.com/cnvs/canvas/issues/359
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-94hc-7qc9-34rf

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr version 6.0.2 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Product details that can result in execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000509
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/issues/7727
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqfh-p9h7-m6v5

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM is affected by stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in versions through 7.0.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18259
  • https://www.wizlynxgroup.com/security-research-advisories/vuln/WLX-2017-008
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4323-cfj5-98mh

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
The test_sql_and_script_inject function in htdocs/main.inc.php in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 6.0.4 blocks some event attributes but neither onclick nor onscroll, which allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-17971
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/issues/8000
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qjq9-wx5j-jrg6

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
phpMyAdmin versions 4.7.x (prior to 4.7.6.1/4.7.7) are vulnerable to a CSRF weakness. By deceiving a user to click on a crafted URL, it is possible to perform harmful database operations such as deleting records, dropping/truncating tables etc.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000499
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45284/
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-9/
  • http://cyberworldmirror.com/vulnerability-phpmyadmin-lets-attacker-perform-drop-table-single-click/
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201208204518/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040163
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f9hx-5jq4-fgjm

entry.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp] SimpleSAMLphp XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
The consentAdmin module in SimpleSAMLphp through 1.14.15 is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Scripting attack, allowing an attacker to craft links that could execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the victim's web browser.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18121
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/02/msg00008.html
  • https://simplesamlphp.org/security/201709-01
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4127
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fv7m-wc3v-wr3w

entry.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp] SimpleSAMLphp allows timing side-channel attacks
entry.content:
The (1) Htpasswd authentication source in the authcrypt module and (2) SimpleSAML_Session class in SimpleSAMLphp 1.14.11 and earlier allow remote attackers to conduct timing side-channel attacks by leveraging use of the standard comparison operator to compare secret material against user input.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12872
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2017/12/msg00007.html
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/06/msg00017.html
  • https://simplesamlphp.org/security/201703-01
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v882-949x-6v28

entry.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Shopware v5.2.5 - v5.3 is vulnerable to cross site scripting in the customer and order section of the content management system backend modules. Remote attackers are able to inject malicious script code into the firstname, lastname, or order input fields to provoke persistent execution in the customer and orders section of the backend. The execution occurs in the administrator backend listing when processing a preview of the customers (kunden) or orders (bestellungen). The injection can be performed interactively via user registration or by manipulation of the order information inputs. The issue can be exploited by low privileged user accounts against higher privileged (admin or moderator) accounts.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15374
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43849/
  • https://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=1922
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mvrx-cmqw-2jgj

entry.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware XXE Vulnerability
entry.content:
Shopware before 5.3.4 has a PHP Object Instantiation issue via the sort parameter to the loadPreviewAction() method of the Shopware_Controllers_Backend_ProductStream controller, with resultant XXE via instantiation of a SimpleXMLElement object.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18357
  • https://blog.ripstech.com/2017/shopware-php-object-instantiation-to-blind-xxe/
  • https://demo.ripstech.com/projects/shopware_5.3.3
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/152995/Shopware-createInstanceFromNamedArguments-PHP-Object-Instantiation.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6m27-7cqj-2mxw

entry.title: [getkirby/cms] Kirby XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Kirby Panel before 2.3.3, 2.4.x before 2.4.2, and 2.5.x before 2.5.7 exists when displaying a specially prepared SVG document that has been uploaded as a content file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16807
  • https://getkirby.com/changelog/kirby-2-5-7
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/144965/KirbyCMS-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43140/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-275c-v3rc-xghx

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
There are CSRF vulnerabilities in Subrion CMS 4.1.x through 4.1.5, and before 4.2.0, because of a logic error. Although there is functionality to detect CSRF, it is called too late in the ia.core.php code, allowing (for example) an attack against the query parameter to panel/database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15063
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/547
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/570
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rc94-7v55-wmg6

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
Subrion CMS 4.1.5 has CSRF in blog/delete/.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18366
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/477
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c939-g732-48r8

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSS Injection Vulnerability
entry.content:
phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4, and 4.6 are vulnerable to a CSS injection attack through crafted cookie parameters

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000015
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123220229/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95726
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3fgq-cmr4-97rr

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSS Injection Vulnerability
entry.content:
phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4, and 4.6 are vulnerable to a CSS injection attack through crafted cookie parameters

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000015
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123220229/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95726
